title: How to Make a Long Distance Boyfriend Jealous (and Get Him to Think about You!)

steps.title: Get him guessing about what you’re doing and who you’re with.
steps.content: Get him guessing about what you’re doing and who you’re with. Get all dolled up and then snap a quick pic to show him. If he asks about your plans, try to be vague and don’t tell him much. Even if you’re just sitting at home with your hair and makeup done, he’ll be wondering who you got all dressed up for. [1] X Research source Bonus points if you text him a hot selfie and then stop replying for a few hours.

steps.title: Make sure to post lots of pictures, too.
steps.content: Make sure to post lots of pictures, too. Go out to a bar, a club, or hit the town in your cutest outfit. Then, put the photos on social media where you know he’ll see them. When he sees that you’re having tons of fun without him, he’ll probably wish he was there with you. [2] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 5 November 2019. [3] X Research source You could also have your friends post pictures and tag you in them. That way, it won’t seem like you’re intentionally trying to make him jealous.

steps.title: Or at least wait a while to text back.
steps.content: Or at least wait a while to text back. If you always reply within minutes of him texting you, he’ll know he has you wrapped around his finger. A good rule of thumb is to wait 10 to 30 minutes before responding. [4] X Research source You can do this with phone calls, too. If he calls you, ignore it and call him back a little later. He’ll wonder what you were doing that made you too busy for a phone call. This might work to get his attention, but in the long run, you should probably have a real conversation about whatever is bothering you. [5] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 5 November 2019.

steps.title: Be wishy washy about when you’ll see each other next.
steps.content: Be wishy washy about when you’ll see each other next. If he suggests a visit sometimes soon, say something like, “Yeah, I’ll have to check my calendar.” If you sound too busy to hang out with him, he’ll probably wonder who else you have plans with. [6] X Research source Be careful with this one—in long distance relationships, it’s super important to visit each other in person as often as you can. If you blow him off too much, he might lose interest in the relationship.

steps.title: Make it seem like you have plans all the time.
steps.content: Make it seem like you have plans all the time. If he asks what you’re up to, tell him you’re going out to a club or hanging out with friends. Try not to tell him when you’re bored or just lounging around the house, since that can make it seem like you can’t have fun without him. [7] X Research source You could also say something like, “Omg, I’m soooo tired. I had the craziest weekend ever.”

steps.title: Leave a little mystery surrounding your plans for the day.
steps.content: Leave a little mystery surrounding your plans for the day. If you’re going out to dinner, don’t tell him exactly who will be there (even if it’s just a group of friends). When you don’t get specific, he’ll probably make up facts to fill in the gaps, which can leave him feeling jealous. [8] X Research source You could also say something like, “I was thinking about heading into the city today. I might meet up with someone I know there.”

steps.title: Let him know that someone else gave you attention.
steps.content: Let him know that someone else gave you attention. Try to mention it casually in a phone call or over text so it doesn’t sound like you’re bragging. You don’t have to get super specific, and you can even make it up if you want to. [9] X Research source Say something like, “A guy tried to give me his number last night. I told him thanks but no thanks, but he just wouldn’t drop it!”

steps.title: Casually name drop your guy friends in a conversation.
steps.content: Casually name drop your guy friends in a conversation. You could mention how one of them gave you a ride home or just got a new haircut. The more you mention other dudes, the more your boyfriend will wonder about who you’re hanging out with and what you two are doing. Say stuff like: [10] X Research source “Chris gave me a ride home from work last night.” “Did you see Jacob’s new haircut? It looks pretty good!”

steps.title: Make him think you like them more than him.
steps.content: Make him think you like them more than him. Even if you don’t see his friends very often, you can still stalk their social media and get info that way. Try to casually mention that you think his friends are cool (or even compare them to him). For instance: [11] X Research source “It’s so cool that James helped his girlfriend move. Remember when I moved? I don’t think you helped me at all!” “I saw Robbie’s new car, it looks pretty cool.”

steps.title: There’s no better way to make someone jealous.
steps.content: There’s no better way to make someone jealous. You don’t have to go overboard, but you can mention things that your ex used to do that you really liked. Even if your boyfriend isn’t the jealous type, name-dropping someone you used to date will surely get him green with envy. [12] X Research source For example, you might say, “Oh, I remember when me and Shawn went there! It was a really romantic restaurant.” Or, “We should totally go to Hawaii next summer. Kyle and I vacationed there one year, and it was so much fun.”
